intro: Teijsmanniodendron sinclairii, commonly known as the Singapore flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, fiery orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves that are elliptical in shape and arranged alternately along the branches. It thrives in humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall and is well-suited for urban landscaping in warm regions.
